author: Eduard
text: 'Very nice ambience and high quality food
column5: very nice staff too - seldom luxury these days. Tried smoked Amish chicken and assorted smoked seafood served with toasts - delicious
column6: followed by heavenly cheesecake. Top notch quality of ingredients
column7: very pleased with that. I would suggest placing guests at a greater distance from each other though
column8: packing one area tightly while 75% of tables are vacant is concerning
column9: and by the looks of it it was not a 6 ft. distance. May be they were expecting more guests at other tables
column10: but we were there for a good hour and a half
column11: noticed not much influx... Aside from that very solid performance

author: Samantha Palermo
text: 'I’ve eaten at this restaurant three times. All three times the atmosphere
column5: food
column6: drinks
column7: and service were exceptional.'

author: Sheila Benjamin
text: 'Halifax is one of our favorite places to dine; simple elegant room
column5: accommodating and engaging staff
column6: delicious food- what more can you ask for? The view is unforgettable and so is the dining experience!'

author: Zac Levin
text: 'Very limited vegetarian'

author: PAUL epstein
text: "Went for a friend's Birthday party.. excellent service"

author: Jason Petersen
text: 'Good service. Asked for an off menu item and they had no problem making it'

author: Kyrsten Musich
text: 'Awesome brunch spot. Come hungry and ready to enjoy the various courses. Great value for a fun and different take to brunching'

author: Amelia Silvestri
text: 'OMG this place was amazing.. we sat at the bar and had the small plate brunch. I loved the experience of eating so much I had to write a review. Evan our bartender was great too'

author: Ola Nesgovorov
text: 'The staff is super nice & polite
column5: the location & embience is very nice.\n\nBut the food was not up to the expected standard unfortunately
column6: I ordered a chicken breast sandwich
column7: came absolutely burnt.\nFrom what I see in other reviews it just seems like an issue of inconsistency in expirience.'

author: Samuel Lopez
text: 'Nice place and excellent food.goof for parties'

author: Sobe
text: "We had their brunch menu and it's very satisfying. We loved almost all of the plates and the wine was perfect. I'll recommend booking in advance since it gets very busy"

author: Stephen Mulkins
text: 'Enjoyable experience.'

author: Merytel Rodriguez
text: 'Made a reservation and went to Brunch and Bubbles for one of my best friends birthday and had such a great time! Good job and unlimited mimosas for a couple hours 10/10!'

author: Autohaus Int'l
text: 'A bit expensive'

author: April Gray
text: 'Beautiful place.. awesome  food'

author: Anthony Mai
text: "The vibe is definitely very nice. Has a classy feel to it but don't feel pressured to dress up though (but doesn't hurt to not). The food itself wasnt amazing to blow my hats off but it was very well flavored."

author: Sara Finnegan
text: 'Excellent brunch.'

author: zi nyc
text: 'The restaurant is inside the W Hotel. Good service and polite staff. Very nice atmosphere for a weekend brunch that included unlimited drinks and small plates for a super reasonable rate. The place is right on the river front so it has a nice nyc view.'

author: sal salerno
text: 'Food not that good & way to expensive'

author: LauSofia SM
text: 'Lovely'

author: Egemen
text: 'Very poor service experience. Sat at the bar. waited for 10 min for the barmen to ask what I’d like to drink. Waited another 10min for him to make a martini that costs $16+tax. The martini is not even served in a classic tall martini glass..The guys sat next to me
column5: they also waited quite long just to give an order. The barmen told everyone that he is sorry for the wait. If you are 5 star hotel
column6: the service should be similar. When not
column7: you lose customers.'

author: Sean Reeves
text: 'Great Brunch. Food was good and vibe was nice.'

author: Nate M
text: 'Fun Sunday brunch that included unlimited drinks and food for a super reasonable rate.  Fun environment
column5: right on the river front.'

author: catherine呂
text: 'the bubble brunch is amazing'

author: Terri Antonelli
text: 'Italian feast outside made it a different experience.'

author: Kash K
text: 'Review 2: I’m writing this review for rating the general manager. He is extremely unprofessional and rude. Literally the definition of awful customer service.\n\nThanks to other professional people who work here
column5: the issue was resolved. That’s why I gave them a 5 star review earlier. ( Review 1)\n\nAlthough we love the food and service at Halifax
column6: we won’t be back because of the GM.'

author: Khash Koly
text: 'Review 1: My wife and I had our baby shower at the restaurant today. I’d like to thank Olivia and her team for providing an excellent service. Our server was very professional
column5: helpful and responsible as well. We would give them 10 stars if we could.\n\nPlease read my second review for the General Manager.'

author: Miss Consumer
text: 'I loved it! The ambiance
column5: the food
column6: the service. My friend and I came here to treat ourselves
column7: but it’s a great spot for a date.'

author: Ashton ku
text: "I went with two of my friends. This was our first time going to this restaurant after COVID months. Service was ok as we didn't have to wait for too long. However
column5: the quality of food and selection of menu was not very impressive. Menu seems to be stale and full of regular staple items then innovative food menu. We didn't enjoy the food as much as we did couple of times before. I don't think i can recommend my friends or go again there. There was no excitement to try the food. It's not worth it."

author: Don Abrahamsen
text: 'The food is locally sourced and prepared in house.  This has been one of the best meals I have had in a long time.  Hats off to the chef and staff.  What a wonderful dining experience.  Try anything on the menu and you will not be disappointed.'

author: Michael Regalado
text: 'Highly enjoyed the small plates and the unlimited champagne. Kudos to the servers being on point with the refills. Amazing dishes
column5: will definitely be going again.'

author: Vish S
text: 'Great but pricey'

author: Collette Andrews - Realtor
text: 'What a great place for a special time!  The cocktails
column5: the food
column6: the ambience
column7: and the view all lend to making your time spent there special.  Halifax is one of my go to restaurants for any celebration.'

author: Kyle St. Clair
text: 'Great atmosphere and nice view! Came with my girlfriend for a nice night out'

author: Alberina Hoti
text: 'Best brunch spot!! Food is delicious and I absolutely loved the atmosphere!!'

author: followJTusa JT USA
text: "This is our favorite place to celebrate special occasions
column5: and also to just enjoy an atmosphere where well-prepared food and service is of prime importance. Out-of-town visitors get a treat of the Manhattan skyline at night. I relish the appetizer plate of Smoked fish and mussels.The Country Terrine and the Duck Liver Pâté are just as delectable. My husband and I prefer weekdays (we like a calm atmosphere).There is excitement in the air on Week-ends when the prix fixe all-you-can-eat food arrive served on small plates. The menu online doesn’t always reflect new features
column6: such as two different aged steaks offered recently.The Steelhead Trout was a surprise pleasure. Vegetables and sides served with the main courses are meticulously prepared. At a recent lunch
column7: we started with a the #Clam Chowder garnished with smoked ham. It was rich and satisfying. I've tried the smoked Chicken sometime ago but I'd take it easy on the salt. Burgers as well as #Oysters are also served. Desserts are worthy of the hotel status so
column8: leave room for dessert. There used to be a choice of East Coast or West Coast oysters but please check. I always ask that the brioche for my sliders do not get  the least charred. (They listen.)There will be no regrets for ordering bread here
column9: so well worth the calories :-) My old favorite was the Salt Cod and Shrimp appetizer but I am convinced that the recipe has been tweaked since those summers when we enjoyed Happy Hour at the bar. For us
column10: the best waiter is Roosevelt. The man of the hour at the bar
column12: so aptly named.) GM Mr. Wendy Weng took over the helm from our friend Carlos who has moved to warmer climes. Chef Seadon and Sous Chef Michael bring out the best of Nova Scotia recipes.(JBLThabet.USA. 2021. All rights reserved). FollowJT.USA JT USA on Instagram."

author: Gabe Wineman
text: 'This place is overrated. 3/5 was my experience here'

author: Dennis Gilgallon
text: "This is a very elegant restaurant with the W hotel. Though it's not overly pretentious. The food was really tasty. The prices
column5: for the type of place were good but it's certainly not some that I
column6: personally
column7: could afford on a daily/weekly). I think it's a great place for special occasions.\n\nThe view of Manhattan is spectacular as they are so close to the water. Hoboken is typically a great town for bars and food and this one doesn't disappoint. Afterwards
column8: take a walk along the Hudson if the weather is right."

author: James Cleaves
text: 'Excellent food and service.'

author: Claire Villette
text: 'My friend and I got mushroom quinoa and lobster risotto. The food and service were great.'

author: pearl
text: 'Very overrated. Went there at night time and my experience was 3/5.\nIt was too late for my party to order entrees
column5: plus the menu was very limited
column6: so we sticked to appetizers
column7: drinks
column8: and desserts. The waitress MADE SURE we knew we were taking up a table that was not profitable for them. She kept coming back and making faces. Personally
column9: we found her very rude. Couldn’t even finish what we ordered in peace.\nOther than that
column10: it is a well decorated restaurant and has a good location.'

author: Michael Andler
text: "Service attention is good
column5: unlimited cava and bloody's has value
column6: brunch variety and creativity is great
column7: plating is done well
column9: food quality is ok but plate push by bussers is annoying. We arrived late to close of brunch so maybe got stuck with the service change rush!!"

author: Yoann Bentz
text: "The brunch is very good
column5: but it ends up being a lot of food. They say it's unlimited
column6: but we could only order one more of the dishes we liked because of how full we were!\n\nAlso careful with the bottle of champagne or you'll end up getting a non-desirable afternoon hangover :)"

author: High Virtue
text: 'Great food and even better hospitality. Ony and Angel were exceptional! Definitely coming and requesting these two.'

author: Samantha Parreiral
text: 'Probably the worse portion and worst\nRibeye steak we had. All grease and paid $90. For the location-not worth it.'

author: Kristina Sydir
text: 'I went there in a group for brunch and at first we thought that the food wasn’t going to be enough but those mini bites are very rich in flavor. Starting from a gazpacho
column5: parfait and fruit bowl
column6: French toast
column7: going into arugula salad with Israeli cous cous and cranberries which helps to take a break from starchy and more dense foods such as pasta “orecchiette”
column8: meatballs
column9: eggs.. also during brunch you can ask for a second round of a specific food. In addition to all that mimosas are bottomless and all the staff is very welcoming.'

author: Pris Lee
text: 'Service was great
column5: food was a bit above average (but not outstanding as I would expect from a hotel restaurant). Ordered mussel starter
column6: bass tartare and fritta. A good handful of mussels were bad (I had to spit it out)
column7: and fritta basket was a bit overcooked
column8: but tartare was delicious.'

author: Petronila Garcia
text: 'Great food. Great service.  I sat outdoors and enjoyed a perfect view of the NYC skyline'

author: Mel M
text: 'Shocker! Their Pork Chop is AMAZING!! And I didnt even think I liked pork chop
column5: I just wanted something different.'

author: nika bodokia
text: 'I don’t like foods and also deserts. Last time when i when there was awesome but at this time to bad. Looks like you change chef.'

author: Matthew Feinberg
text: 'Everything was a dream. Perfectly cooked NY Strip and veggies. Beautiful spot on the waterfront.'

author: Dave Senor
text: 'Very friendly service and good food...'

author: Ruby Singh
text: 'Love the ambiance. The service is good as well. For the champagne brunch
column5: they are really good with refilling the champagne glasses. They also do their best to accommodate allergies.'

author: Laura Akdemir
text: 'This place is completely overrated! The food was so bland
column5: and the drinks were wateredown.'

author: Melanie Kohler
text: 'Had my sons baptism here a few weeks ago. The food is amazing (if it ever comes) & the space is semi private & well decorated. Our service was absolutely terrible. We were bussing our own tables. My husband & I were sitting at our own table & didn’t get HALF of the items. They just stopped serving us
column5: yeah
column6: the people paying nearly $5k for a baptism. They did the same to my guests who spoke up about it. My guests also left before the party was over
column7: that’s how slow the service was. Tables weren’t set up correctly. Event manager wasn’t there day of event & didn’t even bother to tell me ahead of time. Cake was  brought out after asking a dozen times. Totally understaffed. I could go on & on. I even reached out after I slept on it for a few days because I was still disappointed. I was told “I’ll speak to the GM” & a week later no response still. This place came highly recommended for an event but I would avoid at all costs!'

author: Zarah Thanasides
text: 'Wonderful view. The little gem Caesar was nothing to write home about. The oysters were excellent.'

author: Dessie Hristov
text: 'I really enjoyed it. Service was good
column5: food was also good. The duck liver pate was to die for. We sat there for lunch outside and the weather was perfect for it. I would recommend the french rose by the glass. Definitely the spot with a wonderful view of NYC.'

author: Courtney Desh
text: 'Ony was the best server! Amazing restaurant
column5: good prices. Tapas style with small plates. Bottomless Prosecco option'

author: Valerie Woodson
text: 'We enjoyed our evening at Halifax.  The mussels w/sausage was delicious.  The broth
column5: so enjoyable!  My friend has seafood stew which she enjoyed but mentioned the seafood was dry. I had scallops which were good.   Sorbet for dessert was the perfect ending.'

author: Addison Taylor
text: 'Good. Best adultish lux bar in HB but music needs a legit revision. "I saw the sign" really played last time I was there. (cringe)'

author: Be Happy 973
text: 'Had high expectations based on location and prices. Disappointed from the start. Waited 10 min. For a menu that never came. Had to finally ask hostess. Order the Hoboken IPA for $10. Was not cold and was not even a pint. Ordered the lobster role for $31
column5: what a joke in terms of quantity and taste. Ordered it on a bed of salad and it came on one leave of salad. Also ordered the Halifax burger for $16 medium cooked. It was yummy except for the center being rare. Waitress was not too attentive at all. Mind this was on a Wednesday afternoon with few patrons. Will never go back and would not recommend. Prices do not reflect what you get. BUT the view onto NY was beautiful.'

author: GiGi
text: 'I arrived for the midday menu 3-5pm it was a pretty light menu. I had the lamb meatballs
column5: and 12 oysters. The oysters were $1.50 each today
column6: usually $3.25 each. Everything tastes amazing
column7: just small portions on the midday menu.'

author: Barney Simon
text: "Brunch was amazing. Reasonable flat rate ($45 right now) for 15 small plates
column5: served family style at the table
column6: and sparkling wine or Bloody Mary's. Plus reservice of any of the plates you want to revisit. The table is preset with a bottle of OJ and a bottle of Strawberry Juice as mixers."

author: Zaida Elinor
text: 'Wouldn’t know how the food is bc the hostess was particularly rude
column5: telling us to be up at a certain time and talking us out of wanting to eat the prix fixe brunch menu with its “high price”.'

author: Shanae Tay
text: 'Loved the small plates'

author: Justine V
text: 'Went here for boozy brunch. Had the best time! Friendly staff and loved all the taps. The meatballs
column5: grilled cheese and French toast were our favorites.\n\nDefinitely make reservations in advance.'

author: Raymond Kanevsky
text: 'Decent meal in Hoboken in a nice setting within the W hotel. For appetizers
column5: the salmon flatbread
column6: deviled eggs
column7: and oysters were all average. The sea bass tar tar was a nice surprise. As for entrees
column8: the pork chop was great
column9: lobster pasta above average and Amish chicken as expected.'

author: Felipe Arango U.
text: 'Good food
column5: great view
column6: excellent service. Just a small hiccup with the anniversary desert that said happy Bday instead'

author: Drunken Pop Culture
text: "Aww man don't know how many times I've been here
column5: but it never disappoints!"

author: Rutvik Parekh
text: 'Little expensive but worth a visit for a good evening! The Manhattan skyline view from the outer tables is great.'

author: Lorrie Recine
text: 'I wouldn’t give this restaurant a star at all
column5: but I have no choice in the matter.  Poor food menu
column6: I would say the worst menu out of any restaurant I have ever been to. Not accommodating at all. .  Couldn’t  make any drinks we asked for. Couldn’t put our two tables together to celebrate a small birthday dinner.  Food items were cheap in quality
column7: but had the nerve to charge 5.00 for bread for the table. But
column8: glad we asked for the bread it was the only item that tasted good. Last but not least
column9: the table and chairs were cheap. Felt like I was at a diner. Looking at people eating outside was apparently
column10: the great ambiance and the couple of accent walls they had in the restaurant.   I would never go back
column11: Even if the place gave me free dinners for a year. Don’t waste your money or night out. 👎🏻👎🏻'

author: Loren Rosario
text: 'What a beautiful space! It’s so big and airy. The food was great and the drinks espectacular. The pork chop was to die for. Strongly recommend!'

author: Millie Oquendo
text: 'Came here for brunch. Its like tapas style. Small plates but every single one was absolutely delicious!'

author: L Yang
text: 'Food was just ok
column5: service was nice'

author: Jacson Mathew
text: "Fine dining at it's finest. Good food
column5: great service and beautiful views."

author: Jasmine Samson
text: 'The food was good & the staff was nice.'

author: Yoli Pacheco
text: 'the service was really really great! the food was okay
column5: i think it was a bit overpriced for the food. i ordered a double jameson on the rocks and it was 32 dollars
column6: which was a bit outrageous! it was in a nice location though and it was a beautiful restaurant in terms of decor'

author: Allison Ehrhart
text: "Brunch menu was tasty and service was good. Our waitress was amazing! However
column5: we ordered some food that never came and the time limit is a bit annoying. I would still go back as it's a great spot for large groups."

author: Des KF
text: 'I was looking forward to trying this spot so I made reservations for 11am. They only have two brunch times for 11 and 2pm. When I arrived I found parking easily nearby. I walked in and was sat at a good location and the view was very nice. Mack was our server and she was ok. The main issue I had was she made it clear we had a two hour unlimited brunch limit and we had to chase her down a few times to get mimosa refills while she seemed to have been paying more attention to other tables. For the unlimited brunch it was small bites and mimosas or bloody marys for $45 each which was a good deal. Some of the bites such as the wings and french toast were good but others like the poached eggs and pasta were not. The bill came to about $98 and all in all we had and ok time.'

author: veronica cadavid
text: 'Nancy
column5: our waitress was awesome! The food was delicious and the restaurant is beautiful. The rusty penicillin is a good cocktail.  Definitely recommend!'

author: Amanda Shirley
text: 'Nothing better quality wise at the water'

author: Derek Chan
text: 'Fantastic views. Delicious food. Fish is really fresh.'

author: Loura Said
text: 'You definetely don’t come here for the food. Went for the bubbles brunch on Sunday and was extremely disappointed with the food quality. Very poor quality food and most of the items that were suppose to be hot came out cold. Would never go back here.\nThey do however keep refilling the champaign if you do get the drink package. However food is not fresh and seems made from frozen.'

author: Karen Murphy
text: 'The view and area is beautiful. The service was excellent. They have great outside and inside seating spaces nicely spaced apart for covid. The food was very good.'

author: Monica riley
text: 'My daughter took me on Sunday for brunch and it was amazing.  Our server Marlon was very attentive and made our experience worth every penny.  Check this place out...in Hoboken.  After you are done eating go outside and take beautiful pictures on the waterfront'

author: Nikita Khripunov
text: 'Really good food with a great view'

author: THGI
text: 'My wife had confirmed a reservation for a Birthday celebration and called the restaurant to go over the specifics
column5: and spoke to a person who identified herself as the "manager".  This person was extremely rude and nasty
column6: and without an explanation cancelled our reservation.  We are filing a complaint with the state of NJ against this individual for a threat she raised to my wife.'

author: Tyrion L
text: 'Restaurant was OK. Just stopped in for drinks and appetizers. It was late afternoon and the  place was nearly empty. The food was nothing special. The waitress was really very nice and welcoming. My only complaint is the surcharges. I’ve eaten at restaurants to support them all throughout Covid. This was the ONLY place I’ve ever been charged a COVID FEE. We were charged a fee of $1 per person because of COVID. It was never told or explained to us
column5: it simply appeared on the bill.  If you’re going to assess a charge you should at least tell people and explain to them why. Terrible business practice!'

author: Heather Baumgartner
text: 'I’ve dined here numerous times and it’s been always been fantastic! Having another party here this coming Saturday
column5: can’t wait'

author: Sierrah S
text: 'I came with a friend for lunch and had such a great time. The staff was very friendly and we enjoyed our meal. Can’t wait to come back!'

author: Ernest Baumann
text: 'I admire this restaurant! They provide marvelous meals
column5: their menu is rich
column6: The chef in that place is very trained
column7: I like very much tasting all their food. The dishes are consistently tasty
column8: the service towards the guests is good. I’ve been a couple of times to this restaurant and I was never unhappy. I highly recommend it.'

author: Robert Toro
text: 'Small portions
column5: not worth the price
column6: was charged $6 for COVID-19 something
column7: still not sure what it was.. Waste of time and money
column8: I wasted mine

author: Nikita Miller
text: "This place is a gem!! The food was great and rhe deserts were amazing!! You can tell they take their menu very seriously
column5: to pair flavors together to give you a burst of awesomeness in every bite.. Definitely worth a try to see for yourselves.. Can't wait to go back"

author: Rodrigo Arb de Castro
text: 'Great food
column5: atmosphere and service. Nice skyline views from inside and outside.'

author: Robert Damurjian
text: 'Great food and drinks love  the location'

author: Robert Damurjian
text: 'Great service delicious food and drinks'

author: Randy Lim
text: 'The restaurant was packed on Sunday. NJ restricts indoor dining to 50% capacity. This restaurant looked like running on 100% capacity. Tables were close to each other and 6-feet apart was not strictly complied. Some customers walked around without masks and no staff stopped them'

author: Xiaoxian Dong
text: 'We went for weekend brunch and it turned out to be a terrible experience. First of all
column5: we couldn’t order food and fix menu items came to the table. We ended up disliking half of the food. I don’t get the point of this set up. Secondly
column6: we got very sick in the evening and I threw up 5 times. Something is wrong with the food or drink. The bubble wine seems very low quality. Lastly
column7: the restaurant was very packed during weekend. Drunk customers walked around without masks. Don’t recommend and will not come back again.'

author: Cg Saddle
text: 'Went for Sunday brunch and we had an wonderful time. The small plates were very good
column5: plentiful and very tasty   . They provided a high chair for our 1 year old. The service was excellent! We will be back!'

author: Michelle Szmajda
text: 'Amazing.Period. food is outstanding!'

author: Sarah Kozinski
text: "I'm missing Halifax! I haven't been since the start of the pandemic and definitely need to order delivery from them soon.\nI've stayed at the W hotel that Halifax is connected to a few times and never miss a chance to dine there. My go-to is lobster rigatoni
column5: but you also can't go wrong with the deviled eggs
column6: oysters
column7: smoked salmon flatbread
column8: or any of their seafood entrees. The presentation is always flawless and the food tastes equally as good!"

author: STUART WEINER
text: "What a lovely setting for this restaurant.  The main room has a stupendous view of the Manhattan skyline. The service and dishes were awesome. Fabulous wines. Not only did I enjoy my seafood dinner
column5: but I hurt my neck turning to see the amazing dishes being brought to the tables all around me... The seafood tower looked especially wonderful.  Deviled eggs
column6: Seabass tartar
column7: beet salad to die for.  Great cappuccinos to end our meal.   Can't wait to come back and try out some of the other dishes on the menu.\nVery special place!\nThank you!"

author: Allie Ruiz
text: 'Great service and great food. Excited to come back outside Covid. $1/person covid charge.'

author: Emily Ferreira
text: 'The atmosphere was beautiful but the service was frustrating. If I were to dine again
column5: I would attend with a larger party because that is who got more attention. My waiter brought my partner his drink but never brought mine. The special was extremely hot. When they cleared our dinner plates we wanted dessert but our waiter took 10 minutes to come back. We ended up just asking for the check and he came fast for payment.'

author: Windy Boudreaux
text: 'The food is just that good!'

author: Brian G
text: "You can find me at Halifax on a Saturday or Sunday for their Brunch. For the price you will be pleasantly stuffed and add in the flowing Mimosas...Yummm! I am a W- Living room/top Chef conesssuer. Let's just say it's a thing. Halifax is a hip
column5: beautiful people type of environment that I have encountered in LA
column6: Miami and of course NY. Love everyone from the sweet hostesses
column7: hustling servers and the creative bartenders. All this with a fantastic view of NYC. Yezzzz!"

author: Anuja Puranik
text: "Great restaurant especially to celebrate birthdays
column5:
anniversary or anything special. I went here for Valentine's brunch and it was perfect. They have boozy brunch option which is very reasonable. All the time slots are just for 2 hours so make sure to book in advance.

While booking ask for main level.. for skyline views. You get different small plates from the menu and then you can eat unlimited and ask for your favorite dish again. They usually have sparkling wine on the side.

It's a classy restaurant so dress code is necessary. Staff is very helpful and friendly. Definitely recommend this place with beautiful views
column6: unlimited food for brunch and drinks."

author: Finesseladiva v
text: "It's a beautiful restaurant. As soon as you walk in  you have a nice romantic atmosphere. When you book make sure you ask for the main level because that is the view of  beautiful NYC in that dining area. The food is very good I got the Seabeam which was delicious. The staff is very pleasant and attentive to there customers as well. Price wise is decent so if your looking for a nice date nice try Halifax out you won't regret it."

author: bobby mars
text: "(Translated by Google) It's not bad
column5:
it's that there isn't much variety to order.

(Original)
No está malo
column6: es que no hay mucha variedad para pedir."

author: Nathaniel Kowal
text: 'Food is good but menu hasn’t changed at all in as long as I can remember and none of the dishes in my opinion are really special or interesting enough to not have been rotated out already.'

author: Zoe Johnson
text: "Unlimited brunch mimosas? Great service
column5: amazing food
column6: very affordable
column7: indoor dining? How could you not go? Not to mention the beautiful interior
column8: ambiance
column9: the music...? I'm definitely coming back!"

author: Nate King
text: 'Yo! I proposed to my beautiful GF of 5 years here. The dinner was immaculate! Dessert even better! Wonderful spot. Definitely a must.'

author: Leidy Valencia
text: 'Good attention
column5: the tables are with social distance and more in think
column6: you can feel completely safe.'

author: felipa del rosario
text: 'The best'

author: Jie Shen
text: 'No respect of social distancing. Stay away.'

author: Alicia singh
text: "I'm not going to completely say i dislike this place however it's not worth the reservation and price. The food was o.k. there was few restaurants across the street that wasn't luxury and my bill would have been half the price. My waiter was the worst part he didn't tell us the specials and was completely rude. We saw people get a lobster after us and lied to the manager that is was sold out by the time we sat down. He did not let us know about the specials and from the beginning his presence  was dismal. If I'm going to pay $44 bucks for just and okay steak at least let customer service be ok. Just aweful. I also did book it for the view
column5: I'm not sure if windows are supposed to be dirty but i wasn't able to enjoy it as much..."

author: Yuri Fernandes
text: 'Very good food with nice views from manhattan. Loved their negroni cost only $11
column5: cheaper than other items in the menu.'

author: Carrie Worden
text: 'Halifax
column5: was a delightful ending to a spectacular day/evening. The food was delicious
column6: dessert wasn\'t my favorite "carrot cake"
column7: however
column8: I\'m not a real dessert fan.'

author: Herbert Velazquez
text: 'Food doesn’t taste good. Chicken wings taste RAW. Sliders had NO flavor. They don’t let you take the food home. Too expensive ! Do not recommend'

author: Dion Benjamin
text: 'Amazing'

author: Karya Karina
text: 'Good food interesting main menu.'

author: Frank Deste
text: 'Barnaget Sea Scallops are the best!!!'

author: Michael Rodriguez
text: 'Very exquisite'

author: Someone Special
text: 'Beautiful view of the city and stellar ambiance! Their cocktails were inventive and well mixed. I ordered a gluten free pasta dish - the noodles were overcooked
column5: which was disappointing. Also
column6: the ratio of noodles to vegtables left much to be desired. If we revisit
column7: I would order a bison steak dinner
column8: like the hubby did! His dinner was stellar and he gives it a recommendation.'

author: Dirty Sanchez
text: 'Awesome place'

text: 'Good eats!'

author: Qiimiih De'Vine Lee
text: "This restaurants has one of the loveliest decor I've seen thus far in Jersey. They currently have indoor dining with social distancing and even though it seems popular the service was still wonderful.\nTheir wine selection was the highlight for me. They also had great meats and cheeses to match the selection. I cannot wait to visit again."

author: Inmarie
text: 'Loved this restaurant. Our loud group was treated amazing! We had a blast! Loved the endless drinks and food!! Soooooo worth it! The restaurant is beautiful! A must go place!'

author: Rahim Houston
text: 'Great setup outdoors
column5: great and attentive staff
column6: good brunch options.'

author: Pablo maldonado
text: 'Excellent food
column5: service and terrace.'

author: P S
text: 'I was here for dinner on Saturday. Indoor dinning has opened up in NJ. The service is very slow and it looked at capacity. Our server was great though
column5: she patiently took our order as we wanted almost everything on the menu. Their lobster rigatoni is delicious ! And hands down the best dish. Try their lamb meat balls and scallops. The portion sizes for entrees is medium size as per price of the dish. Their cocktails were okay. Ordered the strawberry Negroni which came with strawberry infused ice cube. Overall a decent experience. The food is delicious but pricy.'

author: Steven Zhang
text: "[Bad experience]\nI understand that it's a tough time for many restaurants because of the coronavirus. This place only provides a fixed brunch menu for now
column5: and I thought it's a good idea because it can save time and make the cooking process simpler and more efficient
column6: but in fact
column7: it didn't work in this place.\nMy wife and I arrived there around 11:20 am and sat in cold wind (below 60F) for more than 45 min before we got the first round 2 - 3 small dishes around 12:10 noon. We complained to the manager directly
column8: then some other dishes (around 6 or 7) were soonly delivered to our table in 2 minutes. Obviously
column9: these food had already been completed in the kitchen but was delayed due to its slow operation. We sat in the wind for another 30 minutes and got the last two dishes (beef slider and cheese croissant) which are cold. We believed these dishes had also stayed in the kitchen for a long time. We noticed that there were at least 2 to 3 tables of clients had also complained to waiters or the manager for the same reason while we were there. We didn't finish these meals at last because we started to feel not well. We paid the check and backed home
column10: and spent the whole afternoon and night at home with the heater and hot coffee. We got cold."

author: johnny jimenez
text: 'Great service and good attention food and drinks are delicious 😋'

author: Grey Willis
text: 'This place has some serious honesty issue
column5: they changed my tip amount and overcharged me
column6: called in and no one takes this seriously. food are so so but they have the worst crew for sure.'

author: Mike Honiball
text: 'As always
column5: the food at Halifax was outstanding. However the service was disappointingly slow and not befitting a higher-end restaurant. A request for more bread was never fulfilled
column6: and flagging down our elusive waiter (who never came to take drinks orders again after we were seated) took a lot of effort.'

author: AnbenK
text: 'This place overcharged my credit card
column5: disgusting.'

author: Mar D
text:
'Unlimited brunch ...great
We tried all the dishes small portions
They refilled my mimosa often
Great place
Little expensive but worth it..'

author: Nihad Elco
text: "Marcela was by far the most unprofessional waitresse i ever met. She got a nasty attitude
column5: bad service

column7: i visit the restaurant twice  week. I wouldn't go back there again and I'll make sure to tell all my friends and family. And btw today wasn't the first she served me"

great experience! The service was really good and everybody at the table loved the food.

The plates are smaller than normal but they are all good so just plan to order a couple apps and also be ready to eat dessert as well.

Good stuff!! You will enjoy it'

text: "Came here for brunch with friends hoping it would be good for the hefty price. The food was mediocre and cold and they kept taking away the food while we were still eating. I hope I'm not being delusional but the most surprising fact was that some waiters/waitresses were too busy talking to each other and not attending us. We waited more than 5 minutes just to get someone's attention. Not worth it."

text: 'The ambience is great... Drinks are decent.... But the food can be a hit or a miss.. my friend got a pasta that was good but the lobster pasta I got was not at all good... I did not eat it and had my mojito and left...the staff is also nice'

text: 'Went for Sunday Brunch. Great for large crowds.  We had a party of 8. It is a pre-set menu.  Everyone gets to taste the entire menu. You are free to ask for more of whatever.  You are not able to make any  food home. So be aware of all that you are ordering extra.\n\nThe fruit with yogurt

author: Estevan Feliciano
text: 'I need to highlight what an awesome server William is! Not only was he polite
column5: he was willing to bend the rules for our experience. That’s what’s up! Managers please give him a raise or promotion cuz if he is not there when I come back we will have issues. And I don’t leave reviews sooooooo.'

author: Alex Lieberman
text: 'Amazing meal with the most interesting ambiance / atmosphere. Had a wonderful experience with friends and loved every moment and every bite. Highly recommended.'

author: Raisa Brown
text: 'Food is amazing. Drinks were so good. Coming back soon'

author: Katherine Kaplan
text: 'Worst experience with a hostess in a long time. Came just before 2pm and the restaurant was almost empty. First she asked if we had a reservation. When we said no she said we could sit at the bar
column5: but all the tables were reserved. Their brunch ends at 3pm
column6: with last seating at 2:30pm
column7: and clearly no one was going to come in the next half hour.'

text: "Had a great Valentine's day breakfast"

author: Abigail Lee
text: "Horrible service. We went for brunch and had to ask 10 times and wait 45 minutes for coffee. Is coffee something they don't expect to serve with brunch here? They also charged us for 2 coffees
column5: but didn't actually bring them to the table. Would not recommend going here if you want to be served what you're paying for. They didn't seem under staffed
column6: just like they couldn't retain a single order."

author: Jake Wallizadeh
text: 'Place looked like a zoo with food just left on the table.  I reserved a table for 2 and didn’t even get attended too. I was staying at the W too. The worst place for brunch do not waste your time. Very disorganized and not run well at all. I recommend going to Ainsworth for brunch you’ll be much happier.'

author: Eric van den Broek
text: 'Location is good
column5: nice view and interior. But the most horrible service we ever experienced. We stayed 10 days in the hotel which uses this restaurant for breakfast. That’s really a pity. The hotel is awesome but the service in the restaurant is so poor! Unfriendly. Unwilling. Don’t care that you made a reservation. Twice they said no. Crazy.'

text: 'Food is amazingly delicious! And stuff is super professional! And the restaurant is beautiful itself! We had a great time with my husband! 🤗 thank you guys 🙏'

author: basma altuwaijri
text: 'Good food and good service 👍🏻 absolutely there will be next visit'

author: Abdulrahman Altuwaijri
text: 'Very delicious New York Strip!! I highly recommend it when you want to treat yourself with a delicious steak'

author: Alyssa Ippolito
text: 'Hosted my boyfriends 26th birthday here for Brunch on Sunday ! It was such a success
column5: the food was great and the mimosas were replenished every few sips. Our waiter Terry was wonderful
column6: very attentive. Overall had a great time l
column7: I would definitely recommend for a bottomless brunch !'

author: E. Aguilar
text: 'Brunch is amazing!!'

author: Sanjay Patel
text: 'Good food
column5: great view of the city'

author: Emily Wong
text: 'Loved the lunch I had here. Their lobster roll was decent and the apple fritters were the highlight. Great view and quiet place.'

author: Heinrich Botes
text: 'Elegant restaurant with unspoiled view of the Hudson River and Manhattan skyline. Delicious and creative dishes. Breakfast menu included something for everyone’. Ample parking in quiet area. Highly recommended'

author: Tyler Mulvey
text: 'BEWARE! If you make a reservation
column5:
confirm your party will sit together.

I made a reservation with Halifax for 14 people two weeks in advance.

When we got to the restaurant and our hostess showed us to where we'd be sitting
column6: she said
column7: "These are your two tables."\n\nI said
column8: "Excuse me? We won\'t be sitting together?"\n\nThe hostess told me that despite making a reservation two weeks in advance
column9:
there were two groups who made a reservation a month in advance so they'd have priority to the long tables.

That's fine - but wouldn't you think to mention that on the phone?

I had 14 people now staring me
column10: standing around awkwardly trying to hide their disappointment that we wouldn\'t all be sitting together.\n\n"Can we just push these two tables together?" I asked. "No
column11:
they won't fit." (There was plenty of room.)

The hostess just kept saying there was nothing she could do.

It was a really disheartening experience from a place I otherwise used to love. I felt like they were trying to pull one over on me by not mentioning we wouldn't all be seated together. I mean
column12: why would I call and make a reservation for 14 people if I didn\'t expect to sit together?\n\nFood wise it was all delicious except the soup. Everyone agreed it tasted like burnt cigarettes. It was disgusting.'

author: Dinika D
text: 'Lovely vibe !!! Never been to this place thinking it would be a typical coffee shop of a hotel. But this is great ! :)'

author: J.C Gio
text: 'Great spot for great moments .\nAnd good food ..'

author: Jamie Marin
text: 'Brunch was awesome.  Crossaints
column5: Devil eggs
column6: French toast was amazing.  Mac and cheese
column7: chicken wings
column8: sliders.... Meh.  Ask for hot sauce.  Sparkling wine was flowing.'

author: Mo B
text: 'Views of midtown that never fail to impress and a nice chic feel to the place. Average service but good bites..'

author: Sabrina Browne
text: 'Halifax Hoboken exceeded all expectations for my 28th Birthday Brunch
column5: which hosted 20 of my closest friends. I worked with Maria and her team
column6: and they were amazing from start to finish. Their attention to detail
column7: curated menu and beautiful farm-to-table decor brought my birthday vision to life. I have dined here numerous times
column8: but my birthday event was my favorite. I highly recommend!'

author: Warren McLeod
text: 'Slim selection
column5: but it is the airport.'

text: '(Translated by Google) We only drink cocktails

column6:
and you have to make a reservation. A spectacular view

author: Nathan Turoff
text: 'Better-than-average hotel fare. Spacious
column5: comfortable dining room
column6: expansive water views. Brunch menu is straightforward but well-prepared. Service is cheerful. The best option for brunch in the neighborhood.'

author: Alan Ochoa
text: 'The food was pretty good
column5: the oysters were very good
column6: however the service was horrible! We were completely ignored for the last 45 min of our meal. Waiter never came after taking our order. Do not recommend. The place was empty
column7: no excuse.'

author: Kenny Lombardo
text: 'Great food
column5: ambiance

author: Liz Mathis-Smith
text: 'Great food!! & excellent service!!'

author: Gabriela Esslinger
text: 'Ok... nothing impressive. Wateref down juice
column5: food was ok
column6: view was the best.'

author: Katie Hoss
text: "Best unlimited brunch experience
column5: I've yet to experience."

author: Stephen Conte
text: "Really fantastic brunch.  There's about 15 items on the menu that come out from the kitchen at regular intervals.  French toast
column5: sliders
column6: mini Ruben
column7: potato leek soup
column8: lox
column9: and much more.  Includes bottomless champagne.  Great atmosphere really upscale.  Brunch lasts for two hours and it's all you can eat and drink.  Would go back."

author: Nikola Mladenovic
text: 'The place has really nice location
column5: the view
column6: style and staff
column7: but the food was not on the level that everything else is'

author: John Parente
text: 'Good food. A little pricey.'

author: Michael T Goodside
text: 'This is a nice restaurant.  I came here for a Chamber of Commerce breakfast meeting.  We had a buffet style breakfast meeting so I am not really able to comment on customer service.  However
column5: the food was very tasty and the ambiance was nice in that there is a great view of the New York skyline.  Someday
column6: when my schedule permits
column7: I am going to try to visit at night so I can try the dinner menu and see if I can get a seat near the window so I can view the night skyline.'

author: Courtney Fernandez
text: 'I contacted Halifax 4 separate times to host a private event. When the assistant general manager finally got back to me a few days after my requests
column5: she emailed me. I immediately called her back with questions and she didn\'t seem thrilled I had called so I asked what the best way to contact her was. She said email so that nothing got lost as she "answers them in the order they are received" and she was often walking the floors and wouldn\'t want to miss a call. I emailed back and forth my questions (each time took a day to respond back to). I tried calling after that
column6: but no one would answer. Finally
column7: I told her we were interested in Booking the venue for the day and time she had said was available and to please let me know next steps. No response. This was a Friday. Instead Monday morning I get an email reply back answering another question in my email
column8: but not addressing the fact that I had asked how I could reserve the date. I decided to go in person. After finally meeting with her
column9: and her showing me the space she asks for the date again
column10: and then proceeds to tell me she just sent a contract to someone on Saturday! I said I emailed her Friday asking to reserve the date
column11: and her response back was she gets a lot of emails. Well then maybe email shouldn\'t be your preferred method. This was extremely frustrating as we had told her we were very interested before the final email. A simple courtesy of "someone else is looking at this date" etc would have been professional. Instead of an apology she told me that her original email states nothing is reserved until the contract is signed. NO kidding. I felt that the whole interaction was unprofessional. After that I contacted the general manager
column12: and asked for him to speak with me so I could provide feedback about the process. I still have yet to receive a call or email back. So
column13: after all that maybe I was done a favor because obviously they are not organized or easy to work with.'

author: SILVIA MARIA PEIXOTO
text: 'The service and the food are amazing. I wanna be back.'

author: arthur gronczewski
text: 'Went there for a fundraiser was treated cordially by all and the food was excellent'

author: Christopher Taylor
text: 'Fun downtown area'

author: Ken
text:
'(Translated by Google) One hour of raw oysters and shellfish at Happy Hour! cheap! ! It was a fashionable shop along the river. The service of the clerk was wonderful.

(Original)
ハッピーアワーで生牡蠣と生貝が1ドル！安い！！川沿いのオシャレなお店でした。店員さんのサービスも素敵でした。'

author: Paul Aponte
text: 'Great food and service
column5: love the Lobster Roll!'

author: John Larsen
text: 'Amazing food. Service was also very good.'

author: Caprice Clark
text: "It's a beautiful restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating. You have a nice view of the Hudson River and the NYC skyline. The food is  wonderful and decently priced. The wait staff is amazing as well."

author: Kristina Koneva
text: 'The location is perfect and the staff is extremely polite and friendly. A big variety of drinks and delicious food is offered. I highly recommend this place!'

author: Katt Espi
text: 'Food is amazing vibe is great I love this place'

author: Lydia
text: 'Wonderful service but the food didn’t taste well and it was very expensive'

author: Faisal Mohed
text: 'Cold apps to share were delish. However main entree was room temperature. Presentation of all dishes was good. Service was excellent. Good ambiance overall.'

author: Erika Monroe
text: 'Called for a pick up order for fresh oysters and deviled eggs. Told everything’s fine and great they can go ahead and do it. 20 minutes later my friend is being informed while trying to pick up the order that they ran out of oysters and have been trying to contact me. They did not. Awful'

author: Suzanne Quinn
text: "It's a nice setting but the service is absurdly slow and the food is mediocre"

author: Vanessa Hernandez
text: 'Food was exquisite. The lamb meat balls were amazing and the service overall fantastic! Recommend it 100%'

author: Danielle Lucas
text: 'Not a wide menu selection but the food was very  good. The service was wonderful! Our server Darren K. was great!! Very accommodating.'

author: Lany Sommers
text: 'Try the weekend brunch.'

author: A Petal To Peddle
text: 'Great networking night at Halifax. Beautiful venue
column5: attentive staff
column6: amazing wine selection!'

author: Rayquan Tyson
text: 'I was walking along the Hoboken waterfront last night and I just happened to come across Halifax. I decided to go in and check it out. I was welcomed and seated as soon as I got inside. Everyone was extremely kind. One person who stuck out to me was Tara
column5: I had to ask for her name because she was above and beyond. The food was splendid and the service was excellent. I will definitely be a returning customer!'

author: Jackson Luis
text: 'Food was better than average but took forever
column5: also they played multiple versions of jingle bells IN A ROW. You can get much better food for less in Hoboken'

author: Felicia McEnroe
text: 'Planned a bridal shower at Halifax and the operation leaves much to be desired. The Assistant General Manager
column5: who coordinated most of the planning before the day was great! However
column6: the day of operation was somewhat embarrassing to be associated with the W Hotel.\n\nWhen the bridesmaids and my family arrived early to set up for the shower they were advised by the hostess (or who ever was standing at the podium) that there was no bridal shower being hosted that day. This caused so much unneeded confusion and panic. Not sure who finally clarified - but how disorganized can you be. As a hostess or whoever is greeting customers it\'s pretty simple to provide that person with a run of show for the day. I understand there is a switch over with parties but as a venue that throws events consistently
column7: this is basic. Also customer service 101 .... a simple "let me look into that for you".\n\nThe chef came out of the kitchen to ask about allergies at the party. What a joke ... the ENTIRE menu is allergens that can not be accommodated (nuts
column8: dairy
column9: gluten). Please keep in mind I already discussed these allergens with the coordinator so they should have already been aware
column10: and was told that no adjustments can be made. And if he was double checking ... great. But it just seems foolish for a chef to come out and ask about allergens just to respond
column11: "we can not accommodate". Its 2019 ... Halifax is so behind on the fact that MANY restaurants are making accommodations for life threatening food allergies.\n\nYou are able to pick 10 items from the menu
column12: my table never saw a couple of the food options. Also
column14: food does not continuously come out
column15: it\'s family style and only 2 plates of food per table were served. Myself and many others left the brunch still hungry. Only plus ... champagne was flowing constantly.\n\nThe kitchen started serving food late
column16: almost 30 min into the party. 1 min before the party was over (2 hour party) they were already kicking us out. Extremely rude considering we accommodated the restaurant\'s late start and horrible customer service.\n\nI would never have another party at this venue
column17: especially considering the prices they charge. If you\'re going to be expecting people to pay for best in class service
column18: you should probably master the basics.'

author: Ally Hirschlag
text: 'I\'m giving Halifax two stars because the view and style of the restaurant is lovely and the food was genuinely delicious. However
column5: much of the experience eating there was tainted by some of the worst service I\'ve ever experienced. First
column6: we were told we couldn\'t sit at a table because they had reservations coming in. We were there for 90 minutes
column7: and about half the tables in the restaurant remained empty. Sitting at the bar was fine
column8: except the server could not have been less hospitable. Halifax has a pre-fix option where you get the entire tasting menu plus drinks for $35 per person. It\'s a lengthy menu
column9: so my mother and I were hesitant to commit to that
column10: but our server said that was the only option for brunch
column11: which is simply not true. Upon closer inspection of the menu
column12: we saw that we could do the menu a la cart if we wanted to. The server was obviously trying to upsell us by not being forthcoming about that option. She also said the menu\'s options were small enough that it wouldn\'t be overwhelming. Well
column13: we saw what the full tasting menu looked like because the couple next to us got it
column15: unless you\'re used to eating two to three meals in one sitting
column16: that\'s WAY too much food. Once we noted that we\'d like to do the menu a la cart
column17: our server couldn\'t be bothered with us. She never checked in to see how our food was
column18: we had to hail her down for waters which took 10 minutes to come. The last straw was when we asked to get what remained of our food (note: we got less than half of the menu between the two of us
column19: and we still had food left over)
column20: and she told us they "don\'t wrap up leftover food for people who do a la cart." What the heck kind of crazy rule is that?? That policy is absolutely absurd and extremely wasteful because they\'re just going to throw that food away. Halifax managers
column23: especially in this day and age where so much of the world is struggling with food insecurity (unless of course you send leftovers to a nearby homeless shelter which I doubt you do). Finally
column24: we had to essentially yell across the bar to get our check
column25: which was incorrect (we\'d ordered two dishes that never came
column26: but she left those on the check since she obviously had no idea whether they came or not since she never checked in). If we ever return to Halifax
column27: it\'ll be for table service which
column29: is any level above the abysmal service at the bar.'

author: Vanessa Martins
text: 'I had my bridal brunch here last weekend and cannot say enough about how amazing everything was! The food was delicious! The staff made it all worth while! Paolo our service attendant was phenomenal ! They definitely wanted us to have a great time and we sure did! The manager Maria was very sweet and understanding! Highly recommend this place. The view of NYC skyline is right across the restaurant which is a plus!'

author: Chanel Brown-Legon
text: 'If you come here for brunch
column5: make sure you don’t eat anything before
column6: and you more than likely will not be able to eat anything after.\n\nI came to Halifax after reading that it was one of the best brunch spots in Hoboken
column7: and overall
column8: it did not disappoint.\n\n$35 for unlimited small plates
column10:
and stunning views of downtown Manhattan is a steal!

Most of the food was a hit with only a few misses; and the meal is extremely carb heavy. So lets get into the review of the small dishes.

The Challah French toast was one of the highlights of the meal. It was soft
column12:
and not too sweet.

The Strawberry Arugula salad left something to be desired. I found it dry and bland.

The egg and hash had a nice texture and flavor. I love that it was served in cute little metal pan.

The Spring pea purée tasted very earthy
column13:
shall we say grass-like?

The salmon tasted very delicious and fresh.

The Deviled eggs were light and fluffy.

The Mac and cheese had nice cheesy flavor with multiple cheeses covering the cup-shaped shells.

The Poutine was unique take on the Canadian classic with potatoes instead of fries. This was another favorite; absolutely delicious.

The Chicken wings were a bit too salty .

The Gazpacho has good flavors packed into a small little cup.

The Fried rice had a great aroma when I opened up the cute little box it was packed in. Unfortunately
column14:
the taste didn’t live up to delicious smell; it was kind of plain and shrimp tasted like it was frozen.

The Reuben was another one of my faves so delicious - even though I was stuffed when it came I couldn’t resist eating it.

Finally
column15: the Meatball sandwich was juicy and flavorful.\n\nI definitely will be returning to try out other foods this restaurant offers!'

author: Andreas Schmalz
text: 'Unfortunately I can’t say anything good about this experience. Definitely will not be going back.'

text: 'Very nice restaurant. Has decent amount of vegetarian options  and their gnocchi was fabulous.  Amazing views of the NYC skyline.'

text: 'Food was great. Location wonderful
column5: but took forever to get to me after being seated and forgot about me and my appetizer.'

text: "Food wasn't great and sparse plus $20.00 valet parking with stamp??????"

author: Tony P
text: "Like most hotel restaurants the food is expensive and the taste doesn't match. It wasn't horrible but I could of got the same thing from anywhere for less. The ham on the eggs benedict lacked any flavor and the hollandaise was barely noticeable. They appearently have the brunch reserved weeks in advance but I didn't see anything on that menu that called to me."

column5: it took around 40mins for pancakes
column6: granola and yogurt and steak and eggs to be served.'

author: Asha Phox
text: 'Very nice restaurant. The chic décor makes it a very nice place to eat. The food was really good. I went for brunch and got the bubbles brunch. Service was decent as well. I will definitely return!'

author: Alan Klayman
text: '5 star service food view location in the Hoboken W.  Rarely is a brunch worth every penny charged.  Excellent variety
column5: selection
column6: preparation
column7: and accommodation to dietary restrictions/allergies.  Can’t write enough good things.  Here’s some: beautiful
column8: fun

author: Annamarie Napoleon
text: 'Great brunch..'

author: Thuy Tran
text: "I love the Halifax and was a regular customer.  Attended a friend's son 1st birthday party today
column5: a few of the guests and I are not impressed with the services."

author: Jonathan Otto
text: 'Sit at the bar only. They know what they’re doing. The service is garbage anywhere else. Over an hour waiting to be served the wrong order (entrees) and no appetizers ever came out. Quick update: the manage offered to remove the apps we didn’t receive from the bill. Is this a joke? Thanks for not charging us the items we ordered but you didn’t give us.'

text: 'Nice restaurant
column5: they are making very good breakfast.'

author: Kirit Patel
text: 'The unlimited brunch option is not worth the price. The options are very less for vegetarians. Plus one can only drink few mimosas
column5: would be good if there is an option for any other types of drinks. View of NYC is amazing from the inside of the restaurant'

text: 'Loved their food and service!! Wish they are more kid and family friendly...'

text: "Some of the best food I've had in a while"

author: Anil Somraj
text: "Quiet and spacious. Carefully curated entrees- esp the fish. Largely ho-bro free
column5: so it's a good dinner spot."

author: Maria Alea Machado
text: 'Pretty quiet place by Hoboken standards. Food is good.'

author: Jane Liang
text: "One of the best places to dine with a view. When you enter
column5: the restaurant is picturesque with modern and aesthetic decorations. And once you're seated
column6: you get a great view of the Hudson River and NYC skyline.\n\nAre here for a late lunch wth a friend. We both got the Halifax Burger - very delicious and decadent. I especially liked the bacon-onion marmalade and Fresno pepper sauce. However
column7: both burgers were extremely overcooked as me and my friend ordered medium and medium rare respectively and the burger was definitely well done. The salad accompanying the burger was a disappointment - soggy
column8: bitter
column10: will return for the view and another try at the menu. We came at an odd time on a weekday so service was slow and could've been better. I hope to return for a better experience."

author: S O
text: 'Love it!'
